results.title: Reaching out
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Connop, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Ageing in the New Age”.
Looks at an experiment where the community is benefitting from utilising the previously wasted skill and wisdom of its old people. The results have two-way benefits: the older people feel happy to be contributing, and those helped are grateful for the assistance coming from the aged. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Real inside
results.creator_credit: David Verrall, John Weldon, Derek Lamb, Douglas MacDonald and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Meet Buck Boom—dynamic, forceful and creative—and a candidate for the job of executive assistant at a staid corporation. There’s no doubt in Boom’s mind that he’s the person for the job, but the question is, can he convince Mr. Mudgin, the personnel manager? For, you see, Boom is a cartoon and Mudgin is not used to dealing with someone who is “different.” Skillfully crafted, using an innovative combination of live action and animation techniques, this hilarious short film probes stereotypes, prejudices and hiring practices.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Verrall, John Weldon, Derek Lamb, Douglas MacDonald and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Ageing in the new age compilation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Ageing in the New Age”.
This is a compilation of a series of seven films which examine the issue of ageing in our society. “Hitting a brick wall” is an introductory video; “Under one roof” looks at societies where several generations live under one roof; “With minimal help” is about the Independent Living Centre which offers advice and services to assist the elderly to remain living at home; “The Other side of the coin” examines the issues of pensions; “The Nest egg” is a dramatised film of the options for superannuation; “Reaching out” is about Spain - a co-operative of retired people; “Out of sight” is about Alzheimer’s Disease.

results.title: Out of sight
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, AMP Society and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Ageing in the New Age”.
It is untrue that we all lose our minds with old age. However, some do and the number is growing. The other spouse usually does the caring. What is it like? What help is available?

results.title: Hitting a brick wall
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Ageing in the New Age”.
For some retirement is an unexpected shock. How can one properly prepare? It’s easy if you have the right ideas and think about it early enough

results.title: Ready or not
results.creator_credit: Dianne Milwright, Dom Clausen, Pamela Eagles and Myles-Milwright Productions
results.brief_description: As all children are different and develop at different rates it is not easy to identify school readiness. This program assists in identifying this stage by showing aspects of school life that children will encounter. Discusses how early experiences in the family and at preschool develop physical, social and intellectual maturity.

results.title: With minimal help
results.creator_credit: James Ricketson, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Ageing in the New Age”.
The need for independence does not diminish with age. There are a variety of community support systems now available to people who want to maintain maximum independence for as long as possible. This film considers a number of community support systems which point the way to the future: community-based health care and home help, group home living and retirement villages.

results.title: The Nest egg
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, Suzanne Baker, AMP Society and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Ageing in the New Age”.
A dramatized re-enactment which highlights the options and dangers awaiting the newly retired who are dazzled by investment choices. Stresses the pitfalls that can await those people retiring with large sums of cash.

results.title: Ready or not
results.creator_credit: Colin Budds, David Campbell, Michael Vaughan and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: Conflict arises when a small factory facing closure is taken over by a large corporation who use it as a test case for the introduction of modern computerised manufacturing equipment. Relations between workers, management and unions deteriorate rapidly until an accident in the factory brings differences to a head.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Budds, David Campbell, Michael Vaughan and Film Victoria
